p: Oxidative stress plays a key role in the development of Diabetes Mellitus Type 2 (DMT2) complications [ 15]. In fact, the metabolic irregularities of diabetes cause an overproduction of superoxide in endothelial cells of both large and small vessels, and, also in the myocardium. Moreover, Găman et al. [ 16] demonstrated that these irregularities impair tissue glucose uptake and reduces β cell insulin secretion.
